intro: Maihueniopsis ovata f. calva, commonly known as the hairy flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its flat, grass-like leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or alpine environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in high-altitude ecosystems.
